content:
Posted: January 14
Early Access Review
								It seemed like a dead game but suddenly we have updates :DDDDDDFor now it mostly consists of training camps and gameplanning.  At his point it isn't so intuitive but still there is plenty of reason to be optimistic.The developers have updated the game and it is beginning to take shape.  It's great to see it take shape.  Now the game planning function works, and you get offered fights(strangely with no method to compare fighters skillsets to help you plan) it is starting to show flashes of potential.  I hope fighter rankings and fight purses will appear in the next updates.

								People who are reviewing this game with giving It a negative review are either dumb or stupid or very selfish by putting down the developers. Early access games means that It's a work in progress. meaning not complete. When you people buy an early access title your basically helping the developers with developing the game. I would wait until a few months have gone by before giving this game a negative review. Wait until the developers have had a chance to add features and start fixing the bugs. Posted: October 25, 2016
Early Access Review
								When I saw you could include a large high graphical picture for your manager.  I was hoping the same type of customization were for the fighters as well.  I feel if I can customize the fighters, and create how many fighters I like both female and male.  Then also be able o customize their stats, attributes categories.  I think that alone will great add a great value to your game.  I feel with adding those critical customizations to a game like this will add another thousand players to your player base easily.  I have played managers, mangement games all my life for the last 30+ years.  I feel those key customizations will add a tremendous amount of value, and customers to your game.  I do feel your on the right track with this title just add the ability to add pictures to the fighters, and customer the new fighter stats. Thank you, continue your hard work, I can see the plus side possibility with this title,  I believe you're on to something.

content:
Posted: August 15, 2016
Early Access Review
								This game has absolutely MASSIVE potential! My first piece of advice is to WATCH THIS SPACE! My second piece of advice is to understand that this is really early access, and therefore the game is fairly barebones at the moment. Having said that, Early access gives you the opportunity to get involved in discussions and help shape the game for the developers, so my third piece of advice, buy it, play it, let the dev team know what you'd like to see and get excited for this games evolution!

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 18, 2016
Early Access Review
								Now, this game has potential. I can tell that the developers have a good idea of what they want this game to be, but as of now, it is more than bare bones. You go in, meet some fighters that have no character or anything that will make you like them. Your fighters will win or lose, and you don't really care. And there is nowhere to go. You don't get better or worse, its just that. You can experience the entire game in about 15 minutes. BUT! This game will always be cheaper than its other competition on Steam, so I do reccoemend keeping your money now and buying it at a better price later on, once it is further developed.

content:
Posted: May 7, 2016
Early Access Review
								Well what can i say, this one was the first game ive bought here in Steam and most likely will be the last one. Cause, u know, is it a joke or something? 10 freaking bucks for 10 pictures and 8 menu tabs w/o any control of gameplay, w/o any financial, strategic, gym / w.e. reports? 10 bucks for 45 minutes of waiting for next fight w/o any chance to see it in "record" if u missed it for some reason? U really think its funny or what? Saying im shoked is saying nothing, u know... But im shoked even more by Steam's team unability to check what they really got on their market. Shame on u guys.

Posted: February 21
Early Access Review
								Now, I've only been playing this for a short time, but I feel I had best review it while my criticism is still fresh. First things first, the game works. That being said, there are some issues constantly present.Number 1 being the lack of click acknowledgement at times, meaning that the mouse no longer can click anything, mostly happens in the fighter's "Game Plan" page.The back button takes you to the main menu screen, even when you are in a page where it shouldn't take you back.It works so far, and being early access, hopefully it will grow into a better game.
